title: How to Make a Photograph Look Like a Sketch with the Minimum Filter

steps.headline: Desaturate the layer.
steps.description: To do this, simply select Image >> Adjustments >> Desaturate. You can also press Shift + Ctrl + U instead.

steps.headline: Duplicate the background again and desaturate it as well.
steps.description: You want to have 2 desaturated layers when you are done.

steps.headline: Invert the second desaturated layer (the top one).
steps.description: You can do this by going to Image >> Adjustments >> Invert.

steps.headline: Change the blend mode of that layer to Color Dodge.
steps.description: Don't be alarmed at the result.

steps.headline: Set your pixel value.
steps.description: Go to Filter >> Other >> Minimum and set a value of about 2 or 3 pixels.

steps.headline: If you want your 'sketch' to have a stronger look, then you should set a higher value of pixels.
steps.description: This image is using a setting of 4.

text: Open your image in Photoshop.  Duplicate the background (your image).  Desaturate the layer. To do this, simply select Image >> Adjustments >> Desaturate. You can also press Shift + Ctrl + U instead. Duplicate the background again and desaturate it as well. You want to have 2 desaturated layers when you are done. Invert the second desaturated layer (the top one). You can do this by going to Image >> Adjustments >> Invert. Change the blend mode of that layer to Color Dodge. Don't be alarmed at the result. Set your pixel value. Go to Filter >> Other >> Minimum and set a value of about 2 or 3 pixels. If you want your 'sketch' to have a stronger look, then you should set a higher value of pixels. This image is using a setting of 4.
